You may subscribe to collections to receive daily e-mail alerts of new items added. You can subscribe to as many or as few collections as you wish. Another alternative to daily e-mail alerts is to use the RSS feeds available for all collections.

Your work must be in PDF format with bookmarks or a clickable table of contents, optimization for ‚Äúfast web view‚Äù and without any security restrictions. If your want to upload more than one file, your disseration must be the first file. Click here for infos on wow to create a suitable PDF. Browse No file selected
The item must contain at least one file.

There was a problem uploading your file. Either the filename you entered was incorrect, there was a network problem which prevented the file from reaching us correctly, or you have attempted to upload a file format marked for internal system use only. Please try again.

The application's name you used to create the file, and the version number (for example, ‚ÄúACMESoft SuperApp version 1.5‚Äù).

Your submission has been cancelled, and the incomplete item removed from the system.

Your submission will now go through the review process for this collection. You will receive e-mail notification as soon as your submission has joined the collection, or if there is a problem with your submission. You may also check on the status of your submission by visiting your submissions page.
Actions you may perform on this task:
Leave this task in the pool for another to take.
If you have reviewed the item and it is suitable for inclusion in the collection, select "Approve".
Once you've edited the item, use this option to commit the item to the archive.

If you have reviewed the item and found it is not suitable for inclusion in the collection, select "Reject". You will then be asked to enter a message indicating why the item is unsuitable, and whether the submitter should change something and resubmit.
Select this option to change the item's metadata.
Return the task to the pool so that another user may perform the task.
Please enter your reason for rejecting the submission into the box below, indicating whether the submitter may fix a problem and resubmit.
The task exited unexpectedly or failed. For more information, please contact the site administrator or check your system logs.
The task could not be queued. An error occurred. For more information, please contact the site administrator or check your system logs.

Are you sure the format should be deleted? Any existing bitstreams of this format will be reverted to the unknown bitstream format.
Are you absolutely sure you want to delete these fields? If any items contain metadata for these fields, the field(s) cannot be deleted. You must ensure that no items use these fields.
This will cause an error if any item contains metadata for these fields.

Are you absolutely sure you want to delete this schema? If any items contain metadata for fields contained within this schema, the schema cannot be deleted. You must ensure that no items contain metadata in this schema.
This will cause an error if any item contains metadata within this schema.

Provide descriptive metadata about the bitstream format below. While format names must be unique, MIME types do not need to be. You may have separate format registry entries for different versions of Microsoft Word, even though the MIME type will be the same for each of them.
A unique name for this format, (e.g. Microsoft Word XP or Microsoft Word 2000)
The MIME type associated with this format, does not have to be unique.
The level of support your institution pledges for this format.
Formats marked as internal are are hidden from the user, and used for administrative purposes.
Extensions are file extensions that are used to automatically identify the format of uploaded files. You can enter several extensions for each format.
This is the metadata schema for "{0}". You may add new or update existing metadata fields to this schema. Fields may also be selected for deletion or be moved to another schema.
Additional notes about this metadata field.
The field name is already in use, all element and qualifiers must be unique.
The field's element contains a bad character. The element may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.
The field's element is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's qualifier is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's qualifier contains a bad character. The qualifier may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.

This list of bitstream formats provides information about known formats and their support level. You can edit or add new bitstream formats with this tool. Formats marked as 'internal' are hidden from the user, and are used for administrative purposes.

The metadata registry maintains a list of all metadata fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, eDiss requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new schema.
Shorthand notation for the schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.
Select a target schema where these fields will be moved. If the target schema already has fields with identical names the fields will not be moved.
The ID you supplied did not resolve to an item
Items may be found by handle or internal ID
Click here to go to the item wildcard policy admin tool
Click on a community or collection to edit its policies.
Click here to add a new policy.

With this editor you can view and alter the policies of an item, plus alter policies of individual item components: bundles and bitstreams. Briefly, an item is a container of bundles, and bundles are containers of bitstreams. Containers usually have ADD/REMOVE/READ/WRITE policies, while bitstreams only have READ/WRITE policies.
You will notice an extra bundle and bitstream for each item containing the license text for the item.
No policies found for this object.
Allows wildcard additions to and clearing of policies for types of content within specific collection(s). WARNING - removing READ permissions from items will make them not viewable!
For all of the selected groups...

PLEASE NOTE: These changes are not validated in any way. You are responsible for entering the data in the correct format. If you are not sure what the format is, please do NOT make changes.
Welcome to the item management page. From here you can withdraw, reinstate, move or delete the item. You may also update or add new metadata / bitstreams on the other tabs.
(you are not allowed to perform this action)
Number of changes exceeds maximum allowed. Limit changes or alter bulkedit.gui-item-limit in dspace.cfg
Pending changes are listed below for review
Item Mapper - Map Items from Other Collections

This is the item mapper tool that allows collection administrators to map items from other collections into this collection. You can search for items from other collections and map them, or browse the list of currently mapped items.
{0} of {1} items in this collection are mapped in from other collections
You need the REMOVE privilege on this collection to be able to unmap items from this collection.

Collection administrators decide who can submit items to the collection, edit item metadata (after submission), and add (map) existing items from other collections to this collection (subject to authorization for that collection).
The people responsible for this step are able to accept or reject incoming submissions. However, they are not able to edit the submission's metadata.
The people responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, and then accept or reject them.
The people responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, but will not be able to reject them.
The E-People and Groups that have permission to submit new items to this collection.

E-People and Groups that can read new items submitted to this collection. Changes to this role are not retroactive. Existing items in the system will still be viewable by those who had read access at the time of their addition.
This collection uses custom default access settings.
Default read for incoming items and bitstreams is currently set to Anonymous.

Community administrators can create sub-communities or collections, and manage or assign management for those sub-communities or collections. In addition, they decide who can submit items to any sub-collections, edit item metadata (after submission), and add (map) existing items from other collections (subject to authorization).

message.p: This website is using Manakin, a new front end for eDiss created by Texas A&M University Libraries. The interface can be extensively modified through Manakin Aspects and XSL based Themes. For more information visit http://di.tamu.edu and http://dspace.org

catalogue.message: This is not a eDiss object conformant to the METS 1.0 profile and as such cannot be rendered effectively. You can override either the template that handles the general case in dri2xhtml to perform the needed function, or create your template to match whatever profile you use.

Qualified Dublin Core (QDC) is not applicable to eDiss communities and collections at this time. When using QDC, you should use the QDC crosswalk for eDiss items and either DIM or MODS for processing of communities and collections.

Help & Info: How to create a PDF

p.strong: Publish your digital doctoral thesis Open Access at the G√∂ttingen State and University Library.

div.p: That's the way to do it:

span.span:
Create your dissertation as a PDF file (rather than multiple files) without security restrictions with clickable Contentss and optimized for ‚Äúfast web view‚Äù.
Special rules apply to cumulative theses!
The first time, a one-time free registration is required.

li.span: 3 Click ‚ÄúPublish Now‚Äù and follow the form. Finally, you must agree to our deposit license.

span.a: Deliver two printed copies of your work from us in the SUB.
span.span:
The address is listed below.
Doctoral candidates of medicine must attach a copy of your invitation to the oral examination the print copies!

span.a: Done! Your publication is enabled by our editors.
span.span: On the publication of your work, you will be notified via e-mail.

p.strong: If you have any questions, feel free to contact us:

div.p:
eDiss
Nieders√§chsischen Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen
Platz der G√∂ttinger Sieben 1
37073 G√∂ttingen

Central Library (address see above)
2nd floor left in the LRC, room 2.19
Monday to Friday from 10:00 to 12:00 h.
Appointments can also be made outside of these hours.

li.a: Create your dissertation as a PDF file
Register or log in with eDiss
Deliver two printed copies of your work from us in the SUB.
Done! Your publication will be enabled by our editors.

div.p: Before you start with the publication of your work, make sure that the following conditions are satisfied:

ul.li: You took note of the relevant promotion regulations.
Two printed versions of your work are available.
For doctoral candidates of medicine only: Your invitation to the oral examination already exists.

div.p: Two printed bound copies and an electronic version (PDF file) of your work must be delivered at the G√∂ttingen SUB. The PDF version has has to be one File (rather than multiple individual files), which meets the following criteria. The file

ul.li: is provided with navigation elements, i.e. with Bookmark (Bookmarks) or with clickable Contentss,
is optimized for ‚Äúfast web view‚Äù,
is not protected by any security settings.

div.p:
The printed copies and the electronic version of your work should be identical.
The printed version has to contain your curriculum vitae (CV). You can omit the CV in the electronic thesis. On this point alone, a difference between printed and electronic version is allowed.
The dissemination and acceptance of this form of the thesis varies from faculty to faculty. Please read your doctorate regulations carefully and if necessary consult your examination.

In a cumulative thesis several separate articles for jounrals or anthologies are combined into a dissertation. Are some of them already published, please check the rights situation with the respective Publisher. If you gave exclusive user rights to a Publisher, you may not need to embed the text of the relevant article in the electronic dissertation.

p.strong: Both versions (PDF file and printed copy) will contain

ul.li: Cover,
Contentss,
Introduction,
Disussion with summary of results (Synopsis).

will include in addition all published, submitted or other related articles. Already published article should be included please as an imprint of the Publisher's PDF. The accurate source attribution is important for each article.
An overview of the contained, possibly already published articles is also required.
Dazu kommt eine √úbersicht √ºber die enthaltenen, evtl. bereits publizierten Beitr√§ge.
please add permanent and unique URLs to all the articles already published. This can be such as the digital object identifier (DOI).

div.h3: Create your dissertation as a PDF file
div.p: Guide to create your electronic thesis as one PDF File (rather than multiple individual files)

ul.li: with clickable Contentss,
optimized for ‚Äúfast Web view‚Äù,
without security restrictions.

div.p: The absence of security restrictions required on following reasons

ul.li: As an open access publication server eDiss guarantees its users that you can read the found documents and print them for private purposes. The encryption or print prevention of the document would prevent this.
In order to include your thesis in our full-text search we should be able to extract the text.
In the course of the archiving, it can be necessary to convert your document into other formats.

div.h3: Register or log in with eDiss
div.p:
For the initial registration, please click on ‚ÄúRegister‚Äù in the right upper box at the top of the page!
It appears a form in which your E-Mail address will be asked. After completing and sending away the form, you will receive a message with a link to your future user profile. Please enter here your name and phone number. You can also speify the language in which you want to recieve notifications from us.
This procedure ensures that no foreign person without your knowledge, can you register on eDiss. Immediately after registering, you are logged in.

To log in on eDiss, just click ‚ÄúLogin‚Äù in the upper right box in the top of the page and enter your email address in the form that appears. After sending away the form, you are logged in.
As an authenticated user, you have the option to publish on eDiss, resume interrupted publications or in your profile subscibe to automatic notification via email about new releases in individual collections.
For security reasons, we recommend to log out explicitly (not just close the browser) in the end of the session. To do this click on your name in the upper right box in the page header. There pops up a menu in which the item ‚ÄúLogout‚Äù is offered.
There are to options for starting this process on eDiss:

ol.li: Click ‚ÄúPublish Now‚Äù in the main menu at the top left. You will see a drop down menu with the list of all eDiss collections. Please select the one in which you want to publish your work.

Alternatively, you can first select a collection in the menu on the left by clicking ‚ÄúCommunities & Collections‚Äù. Then click on ‚ÄúPublish here‚Äù and you will start directly with the upload step.

div.p: PLEASE NOTE: With two exceptions, the collections correspond to the faculties of the University of G√∂ttingen. The Philosophical and Social Science faculties are so large and heterogeneous that we had to split them into more collections. If you start a Publication in one of these areas, please look first to these collections to determine in which collection your work belongs!

PLEASE NOTE: As long as the publication process is not completed, you can return at any time to a previous step and change both the input data and your documents as well. After completing the process no changes are possible to your publication! In these cases please give a brief description in the corresponding form field to the respective files!
In exceptional cases, you can contact us with reasonable requests for changes.

To upload of your document a form is displayed. Here you can use the ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù button to choose your document on your local system and click on ‚ÄúUpload File‚Äù to upload the file.
You can upload multiple documents (in any format) one after the other. This is useful e.g. if you want to complete your dissertation with additional charts, tables, survey results, laboratory data, etc., based on your work. Publishing your work in various formats, e.g. additionally for eBookReader is conceivable as well.
PLEASE NOTE: The first uploaded file has to be your thesis as PDF. eDiss accepts only after that files in other formats!

Uploading the first PDF file it will be automatically checked whether the document meets our requirements. This process can take some time depending on file size to complete. Please do not interrupt this process!
Then the results of the check are shown. If one of the requirements is not met, your document is rejected. in this case please interrupt the publication process by clicking on "Save and continue later, correct your PDF file and then take back to the publication process.
When your PDF document is accepted, you can upload additional or to go to the next step with the "Next"-button.
When uploading the first PDF file, some metadata like title, author and keywords saved with the file are displayed in additon. These data are used e.g. by Google in the hit list of a search. Since this data is not used by eDiss, you are quite free to decide whether to apply corrections here. To change the data, delete the uploaded document by clicking the check mark next to the file name and cklick the "Remove Selected" button. Interrupt please the process and save the data. Then correct the metadata in your document and resume the publication process.

In this step you are asked to give additional information to your doctoral thesis. First some personal information (date of birth, address) are required. The birth date is necessary to identify your person. The given address we use as the billing address for the publication fee.
All personal information, along with your e-mail address will be treated confidentially and not visible for user of eDiss!

Further description information are used to describe your work. Please enter the required data (title, subtitle, summary, etc.). Title, keywords and abstract must be available in English. If your thesis is written in a different language, you will be asked to provide English translations of these particulars.
The last field, "Message to the editors" is optional and gives you the option to leave a message for the editors. For example, you can make a special request to delay the publication of your thesis. The content of this field is evaluated by our editors and not made public.
Mandatory fields are marked with "*". You can only turn to the next step, if all mandatory fields are filled in.
Here you will see all information collected in the previous step with the possibility of correction. Please read your inputs carefully and correct them if necessary!

To publish your thesis on eDiss, you must accept the terms of our contract. In this contract you agree, among other things that users of eDiss are allowed to download, save and print your document. The full agreement can be viewed here.
Download contract as PDF
PLEASE NOTE: We alert you at this point once again, that upon completion of the online publication process no changes to your publication are possible.
div.h3: Deliver two printed version of your work from us in the SUB
div.p: The printed version of your work must be identical with your electric dissertation. In the printed version your curriculum vitae (CV) has to be included.
PLEASE NOTE: You can omit your CV in your electronic dissertation. Alone at this point, a difference to the printed version of your dissertation is allowed.

PLEASE NOTE: If you are a doctoral candidate of medicine send us please a copy of the invitation to the oral examination with the printed versions!
The printed copies, you can send us by mail or bring us personally in our opening hours.
Address:

ul.li: Zentralbibliothek
Electronic Publishing
Platz der G√∂ttinger Sieben 1
37073 G√∂ttingen

div.h3: Done! Your publication will be enabled by our editors.
div.p:
As soon as the printed versions of your work have reached us, the editor checks your electronic publication and unlock them. From the moment your dissertation will be visible to the public and you will be informed about the release in an E-Mail.
In some cases (e.g. the PDF file contains a malformed Contentss), it is possible that the editor rejects a publication. In this case, you will receive an email with the reason for the refusal.

PLEASE NOTE: A delay of the publication of your electronic dissertation on eDiss is usually not possible. This would violate the doctoral regulations. Only in very exceptional cases (patent pending legal process) is on special request a delay in the publication possible.

You can interrupt the online publication process at any time with the button ‚ÄúSave and continue later‚Äù. Then you have the option to save your current information in order to continue with it later or delete the unfinished final publication.

For authtenticated users there is an option ‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù in the menu on the left. By clicking on ‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù you get the list of all publications you ever made, then select the publication you want to continue with. You restart at the first step of the online publication process.

To navigate inside the online publication process please use the navigation bar directly on the forms labeled with each step. When using the browser's forward and backward-button we can not guarantee error-free operation!
This can happen in two places

ol.li: Yor document will not be uploaded in the step "Document upload" of the online publication process. See here what to do!

After completing the online publishing process the editors This can happen in two placerf your publication. In this case, you get a message from the editors, in the exact reason is given for the refusal.

div.p: If corrections on your PDF document are required, please do it first. Then you can resume and finish the online publication process with the correct document. The publication was rejected on the basis of descriptive data, so you can turn back immediately the publishing process again and correct the information.

PLEASE NOTE: Your uploaded document(s) and all previous given data are saved in the online publication process. So you do not have to enter data twice. However it is necesssary to accept our contract after every correction again.

li.a: Create your dissertation as a PDF file
Register or log in with eDiss
Deliver two printed copies of your work from us in the SUB
Done! Your publication is enabled by our editors.
Optimize PDF for fast web view

div.p:
work must be available as one PDF File (rather than multiple indidual files). Please create a PDF file with navigation controls so either with bookmarks (bookmarks) or with clickable Contentss. Please make sure that your PDF is ‚Äúoptimized for fast web view‚Äù nd do not use security settings.
Files that do not meet these requirements, can not be published at eDiss.

PLEASE NOTE: If you do not want to publish your curriculum vitae in your electronic thesis, please remove this page from your PDF file before you submit it to us. At this point alone, a difference to the printed version of your dissertation is allowed.
To ensure that your PDF file has a clickable Contentss, please mark all headings in the Word documents as such. You can do it so:
Please place the text curser in the respective header line and choose ‚ÄúHeading n‚Äù in the ‚ÄúFormatvorlage‚Äù, where n is the hierarchic position of the head.
With cumulative dissertations it is advisable to use at least the Contentss, introduction and synopsis as headings. See the section ‚ÄúCumulative Dissertations‚Äù.

If you have access to Adobe Acrobat X Pro (with costs), we recommend you to use this program. This software is on all computers in our learning resources Center (LRC) available. There, you can create your PDF - on request also under the guidance of employees by studIT - from all popular text formats.

ul.li: Open Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Choose ‚Äúcreate PDF‚Äù and ‚ÄúFrom file...‚Äù. Select your work on the local system and click ‚ÄúOpen‚Äù.

Go to the top menu bar on "Edit" and select the lowest point "Preferences" or "Settings ...". Select in the ‚Äúcategories‚Äù dialog box ‚ÄúDocuments‚Äù. Make sure that the Option ‚Äú‚ÄöSave as‚Äò optimized for fast web view‚Äù in the list on the right is active. Then click ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

Go to ‚ÄúFile‚Äù in the top menu bar and select ‚ÄúProperties...‚Äù. The "Description" tab allows you to specify title, author, keywords etc. for your document. These data are displayed for example in the hit list of a Google search.
Finally, choose the ‚ÄúSecurity‚Äù tab and set ‚Äúno security‚Äù as security system.
Save the settings please by clicking ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.
Now save your document. Finished!

div.p: Alternatively, you can install the free open-source software PDFCreator. With these programs, you can create PDF documents that meet all requirements of eDiss.

Microsoft Word (up from version 2007) does offer the ability to create PDF files directly. However the created PDFs are notoptimized for "fast web view". For that a post-processing step is needed. In this case please follow the instractions:

ul.li: Open your Word Document, go to ‚ÄúFile‚Äù in the top menu bar and select ‚ÄúSave as‚Äù.
Go to the dropdown menu ‚ÄúFile Type‚Äù at the bottom and select the option ‚ÄúPDF‚Äù. Please not yet save!
You will see a new button ‚ÄúOptions‚Äù. Click it and select the settings exactly as shown in the picture below.
Then click ‚ÄúOK‚Äù and ‚ÄúSave‚Äù.

div.p:
Now your PDF will be optiomized for fast web viewing.
See section ‚ÄúOptimize for fast web view‚Äù for details.

The simplest method is to use the TeXDocC Service. Pack your TeX file with all components in a zip archive and upload it. The system compiles the file and returns a PDF file. For more information, see the information section on TEX Document Center.
You can use Hyperref to create the clickable Contentss.
For more help on dealing with LaTeX files see this Page below.
The simplest way is to use the freely available Adobe Reader.

ul.li: Open your PDF file with Adobe Reader.

Verify that the presetting ‚Äúoptimized for fast web view‚Äù is active:
Go to ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù in the top menu bar and select ‚ÄúPresettings...‚Äù (the last item in the list).
Click in the ‚ÄúCategories‚Äù dialog box ‚ÄúDocuments‚Äù.
Please activate ‚Äú‚ÄöSave as‚Äò optimized for fast web view‚Äù in the option list on the right.
To save the settings, click ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

Now go to ‚ÄúFile‚Äù in the top menu bar and select ‚ÄúSave as‚Äù and save your document.
The recreated PDF file is now optimized for fast web view.

div.p: With an image editing program you can edit scanned image files. The often used scanning programs are usually sufficient.
In image processing, please perform the following steps in any case:

ol.li: Crop the image exactly to remove unnecessary portions of the image or accidentally scanned background.

Change the actual size of the image, measured in pixels or inches before you paste it into your document. This reduces the file size of the image and the document to be created. Please ensure that the proportions to the original will be retained in order to avoid distortion.

I case of photo or graphic with many different shades, save your image as JPG. Choose on the other hand, the GIF format, if you have a graphic with only a few shades of color. Using these formats, you achieve an optimal compression of the image size. This is the only way to ensure that documents containing a lot of graphics, can be viewed in reasonable time on the internet.
Insert the processed images in the dissertation using your favorite word processor. In Microsoft Word, this works via the menu item ‚ÄúInsert‚Äù > ‚ÄúPicture‚Äù > ‚ÄúFrom File ...‚Äù.

message.h2: Legal provisions in the reproduction of images
message.div:
With Online-Publishing you should consider the same copyright rules as in a print publication.
To avoid unnecessary difficulties with publishers, who may be the rights holders for such pictures, you should get permissions for the print.
This includes:
for the reprint of an image that serves only to illustrate a thesis, you have to obtain the reprint permission of the publisher. Obtaining this permit should be associated as far as possible with a so-called "Verschweigefrist" from 3 to 4 weeks.
the reprint of images discussed in the text is covered by the ‚Äúrights to quote‚Äù. For more information, please visit:
Multimedia Law in university practice Centum f√ºr eCompetence (CeC) in Hochschulen NRW

message.h2: Please note that only the German version of this contract is legally binding.
message.h3: Terms of contract for publications on the document server of the Georg-August-University G√∂ttingen

div.p: I herewith give permission to the University of G√∂ttingen, represented by the Nieders√§chsische Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen (SUB), to publish my work electronically according to the terms of contract mentioned below and to provide its open access on the Internet.

The University of G√∂ttingen is granted the basic right to publish the thesis electronically on the Internet and to archive on its document server. In line with these basic utilization rights the SUB G√∂ttingen is permitted to offer its users a cost-covering Print-on-Demand opportunity provided that no third-party rights are infringed. Further rights concerning the exploitation of the work remain with the author. The registration does not imply any legally binding claim to an electronic publication. Within these limits, users are allowed to download, to save or to print a small number of the online document for private or non commercial use only (¬ß53 UrhG1). The author herewith gives permission to license his work under the conditions of the Creative Commons Licence 3.0 which allows the user to copy, distribute and transmit the work as long as it is attributed in the manner specified by him.

The author declares that by the publication of his resource and its components (for instance in case of cumulative emerging dissertation scripts) no rights of third parties are violated. The publisher dismisses the University of G√∂ttingen from possible claims of third parties. The University of G√∂ttingen is permitted to bar access to a publication if there is evidence that rights of third parties have been violated. In that case the University of G√∂ttingen will contact the publisher immediately and inform him about the blocking of the access.

p.em: 3. Long term archiving and transformation into other formats

div.p: The University of G√∂ttingen is entitled to store the resource and its components in a long term archive and to convert it into other electronic and physical formats and to use them according to article 1 if necessary.

Der Universit√§t ist es gestattet, √ºber die SUB die elektronische Version der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek (DNB) im Rahmen der Pflichtabgabe nach dem Gesetz √ºber die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek zur Verf√ºgung zu stellen. Dar√ºber hinaus ist es der SUB gestattet, die Dokumente fachspezifischen Bibliotheken mit einem nationalen Sammelauftrag, wie den Sondersammelgebietsbibliotheken des F√∂rderprogramms der Deutschen Forschungsgemeinschaft, zur Verf√ºgung zu stellen. Diesen Einrichtungen werden die gleichen Rechte wie der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen einger√§umt.

p.em: 5. Withdrawal of the declaration of consent

div.p: A withdrawal of this declaration of consent is only possible with appeal to ¬ß42 UrhG (the work does not any longer comply with the author¬¥s conviction). In this case the University of G√∂ttingen is entitled to charge the author with any cost which is caused by this withdrawal.

p.strong: If the resource is a dissertation, state doctorate, master¬¥s thesis, bachelor¬¥s thesis or any other kind of qualification work at the University of G√∂ttingen, the author confirms that the supplied data and printed versions are in accordance with the original form of the publication which has been approved by the department and that the appropriate institution has consented to the publication of the work.
If a curriculum vitae is included in the electronic version (PDF) the author consents that it will be free to access.

div.p: I have received the invitation for my oral exam. I affirm to give notice immediately to the staff of Ediss at the SUB in case of any change in dates or if I have to submit changes in my written doctoral thesis.
If I have not yet completed my State exam exam, I undertake eDiss employees promptly to inform, as soon as I have the exam and passed.

li.a: May I publish my dissertation elsewhere after it has been published on eDiss?
What are the benefits of the electronic publishing on eDiss?
Is it possibly to make changes to my dissertation after it has been published?

div.h2: May I publish my dissertation elsewhere after it has been published on eDiss?
div.p: Yes, you may put it on multiple websites (e.g. your personal homepage). We recommend linking to your document with the persistent identifier which your document got assigned on eDiss.

Our terms of contract require only simple and non-exclusive usage rights. You may grant other usage rights to other persons and legal entities, but you need to inform a future publisher about your work being already available open access on eDiss.

div.h2: What are the benefits of the electronic publishing on eDiss?

ul.li: We guarantee the integrity of your document. Every dissertation or thesis will be encrypted to ensure and to be able to check the authenticity of the work.
Your Dissertation gets a persistent identifier (so-called Handle), so that it can be permanently addressed and cited.
We include your publication in our electronic access systems i.e. in the Homepage of the SUB and the University Cataloge (GUK). Therefore your dissertation will be more visible and found quickly.
We register your dissertation by the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek (DNB). The DNB takes care for the permanent archiving of your work.

div.h2: Is it possibly to make changes to my dissertation after it has been published?

div.p: No. To ensure authenticity, ability to quote and permanent availability, you cannot change your publication after it has been made available online on eDiss.

If you deem a correction absolutely necessary, please contact our editors.
According to German copyright law, a previously published document can only be withdrawn if there are important licensing and patent issues, or if the author's opinion on his subject has fundamentally changed (¬ß 42 UrhG). The withdrawal will be documented in the system and the message ‚ÄúThis document has been withdrawn‚Äù will be displayed on the permanent URL.

div.p: During the online publication process you can leave a note for our editors. This enables us to easily assign your request to your thesis.

div.p: Bei einer kumulativen Dissertation (mehrere eigenst√§ndige Artikel f√ºr Zeitschriften oder Sammelb√§nde werden zu einer Dissertation zusammengefasst) ist stets zu beachten, dass die Rechtesituation vom Doktoranden mit den entsprechenden Verlagen zu kl√§ren ist.

Die Verbreitung und Akzeptanz dieser Form der Dissertation ist von Fakult√§t zu Fakult√§t verschieden. Bitte lesen Sie Ihre Promotionsordnung aufmerksam und informieren Sie sich ggf. bei Ihrem Pr√ºfungsamt.
Bei der SUB G√∂ttingen m√ºssen zwei gedruckte Exemplare und eine PDF-Datei abgeliefert werden.

ul.li: Titelblatt,
Inhaltsverzeichnis,
Einleitung,
√ºbergreifende Diskussion mit Zusammenfassung aller Ergebnisse (Synopsis).

kommen die publizierten, eingereichten oder andere zugeh√∂rige Artikel hinzu. Die bereits publizierten Artikel sollen bitte als Abdruck des Verlags-PDF eingebunden werden. Wichtig ist bei jedem Artikel die genaue Quellenangabe.
Dazu kommt eine √úbersicht √ºber die enthaltenen, evtl. bereits publizierten Beitr√§ge.
f√ºgen Sie bitte zu allen bereits ver√∂ffentlichten Artikeln dauerhafte und eindeutige URLs in Ihr Dokument ein. Das kann z. B. der Digital Object Identifier (DOI) Ihres Artikels sein.
